tweets.text:
In Didsbury today I saw the brilliant work the @EnvAgency and emergency services are doing to defend the area from flooding.

If you think your home may be at risk of flooding, please follow the advice and be prepared: https://t.co/HnN45WjPXD https://t.co/7ltbpezYL8

‚õîÔ∏è B4194 (Switchback) between #Bewdley & #Stourport closed

@worcscc @WyreForestDC @EnvAgencyMids

Flood warnings remain in force across England, with many rivers at dangerously high levels. Don't take any unnecessary risks. Check the flood risk in your area: https://t.co/xNlgwQrrt9 

#PrepareActSurvive #StormChristoph https://t.co/HPqCxfG0u6

urls.title: Taskforce sets goal to end pollution from storm overflows
urls.description: New commitments from the water industry aim to increase transparency around storm overflows.

tweets.text:
While #StormOverflows play a role in preventing sewage from entering our streets and homes during storms or heavy rain, we want to prevent the damage they cause to rivers and bathing waters.

We‚Äôre doing this through the Storm Overflows Taskforce. Read ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/lUoIewlbzi https://t.co/dNbzHWrWuE

We spoke to @EnvAgency Chair @EmmaHowardBoyd about the simple steps you can take to protect yourself from flooding.

Sign up for flood alerts here: https://t.co/KuIjpLKutU https://t.co/YKXL8pGzxf

We‚Äôre been to #Montford today, measuring river flow.  #teamEA gathers this data to help keep models and warnings accurate.  Right now there‚Äôs 400 tonnes of water per second going down the River #Severn - flood warnings are in place.  
stay #floodalert.

https://t.co/gczq3lkgff https://t.co/sSLKicB37o
@WorcsTravel @worcscc @firstworcester @myworcester @WMerciaPolice @HWFireControl @OFFICIALWMAS @EnvAgencyMids Any idea how the Powick roundabout looks?

tweets.text: Often after #UKfloods, people say 'rivers need to be cleared'. Actually, no, rivers *need* obstructions to hold back water and #slowtheflow to reduce #flooding downstream. Putting more #leakydams in will help (or more #beavers!) @EnvAgency @WildTroutTrust @BBCWinterwatch https://t.co/ZdYqbjqnxR

tweets.text: New short films by @EnvAgency about protection of water quality and the wider environment. Accessible to all and maybe useful if you're homeschooling. Here's the first one https://t.co/3l3I7XbSaA  #pollution #ClimateCrisis #plasticpollution #homeschooling
Note - always check the @EnvAgency website for news and information about local flooding risk or take specalist advice.. https://t.co/ailzyXlBZ5

The cheek of this guy üò°
The @EnvAgency used to be called the national rivers authority and used to dredge  water ways now they neglect them 

The country‚Äôs flooding and this muppet is trying to have a go at a farmer who has clearly sown this field the correct way ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è https://t.co/ljcvqCJ7kU

‚ö†Ô∏è With rising levels on the River Severn we are making plans for #Worcester city centre road closures & the introduction of contraflow arrangements on New Road

Further details will be provided in due course https://t.co/Mp9tDIfWVp

I'd like to say absolutely massive thank you to the staff of @ManCityCouncil & @SouthwayHousing, who were out there looking after people all night together with @gmpolice, other emergency services and @EnvAgencyNW but who this oaf failed to mention. How rude @ChorltonPkLab https://t.co/eZm8A2x3Jq

@MarethBassett @slowtheflow_UK @EnvAgency @WildTroutTrust @BBCWinterwatch Exactly. When Stevenage recreated as a new town post war, built 5 large ‚Äò#watermeadows‚Äô to hold back #urban #runoff to protect #riverbeane d/stream. Works, but release quite quickly. Scope for natural flood management within them to further improve. @EnvAgencyAnglia @HMWTBadger

tweets.text: #climateemergency impacts, like heatwaves & floods, are rising. The #racetonetzero is essential, but we also need to prepare for new extremes. We need a #racetoresilience. The UK‚Äôs adaptation communication is here: https://t.co/TD2YAGoD5n #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/zJ7wfc02Ed

üîä@EnvAgencyYNE Update on #StormCristoph üîä

Levels are now falling across South #Yorkshire, I‚Äôve been in #Fishlake this evening and defences are performing nicely.

‚òÄÔ∏èThe #Sunset was impressive and it was a pleasure speaking to the ever friendly locals üëå

(Clip as of 18:00) https://t.co/Le5pNOY0YB
@YorkshireWater Do you think this is acceptable? This happens to them every year and it‚Äôs disgusting https://t.co/yk68K5wopu

As conditions improve, levels on the #Don remain high but are back within the riverbank. We‚Äôre working with @MyDoncaster and local flood wardens and have pumps at #Fishlake should they be needed. Our teams continue to inspect the river and washlands through the night. https://t.co/JJvuKkHr2n

@agricontract @SpudSlingsby @EdCTBrown @EnvAgency That much is spent on consultations, studies and reports by the time the hole needs digging there's no money left to buy the spade. Public bodies are full of it.

‚ö†Ô∏è FLOOD WARNING REMOVED ‚ö†Ô∏è

@EnvAgency has removed the flood warning for Stafford and the River Sow.

urls.title: The Prime Minister visits Didsbury following Storm Christoph
urls.description: This week, Storm Christoph brought heavy rain to very wet ground and full rivers. Today, I joined the Prime Minister who visited Didsbury in Greater Manchester where properties were evacuated. When we arrived the channel leading to the flood storage ‚Ä¶

tweets.text: Yesterday with the PM I visited Didsbury where properties were evacuated following #StormChristoph. @EnvAgency‚Äôs flood defences held firm and 23,000 properties in Greater Manchester were protected. Here‚Äôs a blog about that + how it relates to #COP26: https://t.co/1BXemM9lnp https://t.co/0WakFBAJbk

Well done & huge thanks to teams from @gmpolice @manchesterfire @ManCityCouncil & @EnvAgency working tirelessly over the last few days to protect our communities. Brilliant community spirit shown in #Didsbury & south mcr supporting one another, as ever. Here‚Äôs to a safe & dry eve

urls.title: The Prime Minister visits Didsbury following Storm Christoph
urls.description: This week, Storm Christoph brought heavy rain to very wet ground and full rivers. Today, I joined the Prime Minister who visited Didsbury in Greater Manchester where properties were evacuated. When we arrived the channel leading to the flood storage ‚Ä¶

tweets.text:
.@EmmaHowardBoyd accompanied the Prime Minister on a visit to #Didsbury today following #StormChristoph, to see how #TeamEA is working with emergency services and local government to protect against flooding.

Read her blog on the operational response: https://t.co/IojoGlCzXo https://t.co/WJhY9kXgfH

Heavy rainfall across England may cause rivers to overflow. Keep your distance and stay safe. 

If you need to go out, check your local #flood risk first: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY  

#PrepareActSurvive #StormChristoph https://t.co/NUld5Ux9c9
